intro: Carolinea villosa, commonly known as the hairy carolinea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Carolinea villosa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
